articles.title: Kim Jong Un Provides Field Guidance to Rungna People's Pleasure Ground and Breast Cancer Institute
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Provides Field Guidance to Rungna People's Pleasure Ground and Breast Cancer Institute
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, provided field guidance to the Rungna People's Pleasure Ground nearing its completion and the Breast Cancer Institute of the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital now under construction.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Rungna Dophinarium.
					
					 He went round various places of the dolphinarium including the ground viewing hall, water tank for performance, the room for the dissemination of science and technology to acquaint himself in detail with its construction.
					
					 At the ground viewing hall he saw dolphins which moved their habitat to the dolphinarium from a rough sea. He praised soldier-builders for successfully building the dolphinarium.
					
					 He underscored the need to set up an electronic display so that spectators may know what numbers dolphins present and names of trainers as the dolphinarium is the stage showing skills of dolphins and ensure stage decor in such a way as to depict the floor of the stage like a beach to match well the waves drawn against the background. 
					
					 He dropped in at the hall on the first floor and said it looks like an underwater world. He was greatly pleased that it has become possible to invite Pyongyangites to see refreshing seawater in sultry summer time.
					
					 Looking round the cave-style room for the dissemination of science and technology, he stressed the need to build it in such a way as to help spectators acquire a variety of information about common sense regarding ecology and features of aquatic animals including dolphin, shark and whale and other interesting information.
					
					 It is necessary to successfully make various decorations to suit the feature of the dolphinarium in a bid to create an atmosphere of its interior, he noted.
					
					 The second leg of his guidance was the construction site of the Rungna Wading Pool.
					
					 He had walked high stairs and reached the top of the water sliding bed to guide the construction of the wading pool on the spot on April 30 and visited this place again on May 5 to give important instructions for splendidly building it. 
					
					 Soldier-builders of KPA Unit 267 radically reshaped the wading pool in a matter of less than two months in hearty response to the intention of the Supreme Commander. 
					
					 Feasting his eyes on the water sliding bed standing high, he said visitors would like it very much.
					
					 After reaching a 5 meters deep water pool for diving now under construction, he said that when it looks refreshing, it is good for weather in summer and visitors may feel refreshing. Watching the wading pool, he was pleased that all amenities have been provided to fit for the wading pool.
					
					 After climbing the roof of the shower room for bathing, he was satisfied with a large area on the roof where basketball, volleyball and sandy volleyball courts will appear. He said with a broad smile on his face that the Rungna Wading Pool is a multi-function wading pool as visitors will be able to have sports games before jumping into water.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the best construction, repeatedly praising soldier-builders for their feats. 
					
					 He called for completing the construction project before the day of the war victory by simultaneously pushing forward the land leveling.  He set forth the tasks and ways to do so.
					
					 Going round the completed Rungna Alpamare, he acquainted himself in detail with the operation of equipment.
					
					 The last leg of his guidance was the Breast Cancer Institute of the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital.
					
					 He made the rounds of the roentgen room, operation room, sick-room and other places of the institute to learn about its construction.
					
					 The institute is an object whose construction was personally initiated by leader Kim Jong Il and to which he paid special attention, personally examining its design, Kim Jong Un noted.
					
					 It is important to successfully build the institute but what is more important is  to assign able doctors and researchers rich in clinical experience to the institute and fully furnish it with latest equipment needed for curing mastopathy and breast cancer, he stressed.
					
					 It is necessary to establish a proper healthcare system so as to prevent and detect mastopathy and breast cancer in their early stages, in particular, he noted.
					
					 While reading documents containing teachings given by Kim Jong Il, he came to know better that Kim Jong Il worked heart and soul to build the institute till the last moments of his life, he noted, adding that this hardened his resolution to build the institute on a world level.
					
					 It is important, first of all, to make the operation room and all other treatment rooms of the institute sterile and dust-free, he stressed, specifying the issues which should be set right in the construction.
					
					 He underscored the need not to be content with the building of the institute. He noted it is the WPK's policy on preventive medicine to let women regularly visit the institute for medical check so that they may not suffer from mastopathy and breast cancer, 
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that soldier-builders would pay primary attention to the quality of the construction and fully preserve the nature of the institute in the construction and thus successfully build the modern breast cancer institute to be proud of in the world till the anniversary of the WPK foundation.
					
					 He was accompanied by Jang Song Thaek, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission, and Pak Chun Hong and Ma Won Chun, vice department directors of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Greetings to Rwandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Rwandan President
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Rwandan President Paul Kagame on the occasion of the 50th independence day, the national holiday of the Rwandan people.
					 The message said: 
					
					 We are pleased with great progress made by the friendly government and people of Rwanda for the past half a century to achieve the national reconciliation, unity and economic development. We sincerely wish them greater successes in their future work for the country's stability and prosperity.
					
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries with long historical tradition would grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Greetings to Burundian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Burundian President
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Burundian President Pierre Nkurunziza on the occasion of the 50th independence day, the auspicious holiday of the Burundian people.
					 The message wished peace, stability, development and prosperity of Burundi, expressing belief that the relations between the DPRK and Burundi with long history and tradition would grow stronger in the future, too, in keeping with the common interests and desire of the two peoples.

articles.title: DPRK Woman Interviewed upon Her Return Hom (2)
articles.content:
DPRK Woman Interviewed upon Her Return Home (2) 
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK woman Pak Jong Suk was interviewed by Korean and foreign reporters on Thursday.
					 She returned home after being taken away to south Korea.
					
					 She laid bare the truth behind the rackets over "defectors from the north" kicked up by the south Korean puppet regime and their miserable plight.
					
					 She said:
					
					 My father died but I thought I would eke out a living as there were my half brothers and sisters and relatives in south Korea. But that was a very naive idea.
					
					 Whenever my half brother met me, he seemed to fear that contacts with me would bring any harm to him. I had no other choice but to go to the house of my elder cousin by a maternal aunt who was aged 80, and nurse his wife. Words can be easily said than done.
					
					 I could not live there any longer due to financial burden. Then I worked as a nurse at an old man's house recommended by my elder cousin. Later on, I nursed an old man aged 90 who could neither move nor visit the bathroom. I did anything such as cleaning metro stations, apartment corridors and elevators, repressing all disgraces and insults. Moreover, I was compelled to live in horror, uneasiness and irritation owing to persistent watch and wiretapping.
					
					 One time I got a job at a company producing industrial raw materials with the help of a woman called Ra Won Ju, only to be swindled by its director. 
					
					 Engrossed on this, I collapsed on the stairs of the metro unable to balance my body and hurt my knee.
					
					 I had been to a police hospital one night in October last year as I felt difficult to breathe. A doctor told me to name my patron as my life was critical. When I said I had no patron, the doctor told me to go back home, adding I could not be hospitalized. I entreated the doctor to put me at rest there even on the hospital corridor as it was difficult to breathe and I would be brought back again though I was sent at midnight.
					
					 The doctor rejected me and shouted me to go out of the hospital at once or name my patron. The reason that the doctor was asking to name my patron was aimed to get doctor's fee if I die. This is unimaginable in the DPRK.
					
					 It is south Korean society which overflows with jobless persons and social evils. Money holds sway and the feelings of human beings cannot be found there. That is a rotten and ailing society which renders the people's mentality and cultural life corrupt.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Back Home from China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Back Home from China
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the International Affairs Institute headed by Vice-Director Kim Ul Ho returned home Sunday after visiting China.

articles.title: DPRK Papers Call for Creditably Accomplishing Kim Il Sung's Revolutionary Cause
articles.content:
DPRK Papers Call for Creditably Accomplishing Kim Il Sung's Revolutionary Cause 
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK papers on Sunday call for vigorously struggling to carry to completion President Kim Il Sung's sacred cause of revolution, the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 Rodong Sinmun says in an editorial that the above-said cause is not only most just but also ever-victorious one to fully realize the idea and desire of the popular masses, adding that this is the priceless truth proved by the 100-year history of Juche era.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 As long as there are a tested leadership of the great party and the army and people who regard the loyalty to the leader as a revolutionary duty and noble moral obligation, the cause is sure to emerge ever-victorious.
					
					 All party members and servicepersons should add glory to the revolutionary legacies of the President for all ages regarding them as wealth of eternal value for the country, revolution and the nation.   
					
					 They should also advance the revolution and construction as required by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism only, regarding it as an eternal guiding idea of the Workers' Party of Korea and revolution.
					
					 All party members, service members and other people should struggle with redoubled efforts to successfully build the thriving nation with the firm faith that the revolutionary cause of Juche is sure to be accomplished as long as the DPRK is under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They should thoroughly follow the example of noble patriotism set by leader Kim Jong Il, who led the struggle for building a thriving nation with the very strong will after setting it as his lifetime mission to realize the cause of the President.
					
					 Minju Joson also editorially calls for more vigorously advancing toward the final victory in the effort to build a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan of Contemplating Going Nuclear
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan of Contemplating Going Nuclear
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Diet passed a draft amendment to a main law on atomic energy.
					 The Japanese reactionaries added a new item to the law, claiming they would use the atomic energy to make contributions to "ensuring the state security".
					
					 A bylined article of DPRK major paper Rodong Sinmun on Sunday calls Japan's claim an open declaration to go nuclear under the pretext of "ensuring the state security".
					
					 The article says:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries said they firmly adhere to the three non-nuclear principles, the principle of peaceful use of atomic energy and that they have no plan to exclusively use it for military purposes.
					
					 But they all turned out to be an excuse of those who felt uneasy.
					
					 Going nuclear is an ultimate goal of Japan seeking to become a military giant.
					
					 In 1965, the then Prime Minister of Japan Sato at talks with the then president of the U.S. highlighted the need of having access to nuclear weapons.
					
					 Sato's call was followed by Prime Minister Fukuta at the budget commission of the House of Councilors in March of 1978 and Prime Minister Nakasone in the 1980s.
					
					 Japan's ruling quarters openly declared in the 1990s and also in the new century that they have ability for possessing nukes, saying that it is technologically possible for Japan to go nuclear.
					
					 Japan totally denied the Constitution or interpreted it as it pleased in the 1950s in a bid to justify its attempt to go nuclear.
					
					 It conducted a secret research into the possibility of going nuclear in the 1967-1970 period.
					
					 Japan has worked hard to legalize its nuclear armament from 1995.
					
					 It has made earnest material and technological preparations for developing nuclear weapons.
					
					 It set a far-reaching goal of relying on a fast breeder reactor fueled by plutonium in the 1950s and has stockpiled a large quantity of nuclear material by operating a reprocessing factory from the mid-1970s.
					
					 On the other hand, Japan massively shipped plutonium from abroad.
					
					 Entering the new century, Japan has become evermore undisguised in its stand towards nuclear armament.
					
					 The true intention sought by Japan in trying to go nuclear is to stage a comeback to Asia and conquer other parts of the world.
					
					 Herein lies the great danger of Japan's moves to go nuclear.

articles.title: June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Remains Alive: Minju Joson
articles.content:
June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Remains Alive: Minju Joson
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Recent colorful events for reunification held in different parts of south Korea to mark the 12th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration clearly demonstrated their firm will to carry out the joint declaration, says Minju Joson in a bylined commentary Sunday.
					 In the events people from all walks of life said that Lee Myung Bak is going to ditch the June 15 joint declaration but if they struggle against him, the joint declaration can be kept alive. They also called for judging the Lee regime, keeping the joint declaration alive without fail and bringing earlier national reunification. 
					
					 Posted on Internet homepages were articles titled "if the joint declaration is kept alive, the reunification will be achieved but if the joint declaration is ditched, a war will break out".
					
					 The June 15 North-South Joint Declaration is the supreme programme of the nation in which the north and the south agreed to settle the issue of national reunification independently by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation itself and which they solemnly published at home and abroad, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors has persisted in dependence on foreign forces and confrontation with fellow countrymen by insisting on the "policy toward the north" such as "no-nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars" after denying the north-south joint declarations and refusing to implement them.
					
					 It is going the lengths of cracking down on people supporting the June 15 joint declaration, calling them "forces following the north". It rubbed salt into the wound of fellow countrymen who grieved over the demise of the father of the nation and committed hideous crimes in succession, daring hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. The north-south relations plunged into a complete deadlock and the touch-and-go situation is prevailing on the Korean peninsula due to the Lee group's moves for confrontation with fellow countrymen. It is very natural that south Korean people vowed to shatter the Lee group's moves for destroying the joint declaration, and implement it. The June 15 spirit remains alive in the minds of the south Koreans.

articles.title: Struggle for Vital Rights Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle for Vital Rights Called for in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Construction workers of Kwangju and South Jolla Provincial Areas of south Korea held a rally in the area around the Kwangju City Office on June 27 as part of a general strike.
					 At the rally speakers said that construction workers' vital rights are being further encroached upon due to the Lee Myung Bak regime's four large river project. A fabulous amount of money spent by the authorities filled only the purse of the construction capitalists, they noted.
					
					 The workers are undergoing sufferings as they fall short of receiving even insignificant wages, they deplored.
					
					 They condemned the regime for speaking only for the interests of businessmen, regardless of this. During the general strike they will struggle for the introduction of an 8-hour work system at major worksites, wage hike and priority to trade unionists in employment at construction sites, they stated.
					
					 If the authorities turn a deaf ear to earnest call of construction workers, they will wage a dynamic struggle to gain their vital rights by all means, they stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Act of Treachery under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Act of Treachery under Fire 
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- 48 civic and social organizations in south Korea on June 28 held a press conference in Seoul to denounce the Lee Myung Bak puppet regime for attempting to conclude a military treaty with Japan.
					 Among them were the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the Association of Reservists for Peace of south Korea and the Center for Peace and Disarmament of the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society.
					
					 They condemned the Lee "government" for reneging on its promise made before south Korean people and passing a bill on the treaty through the "National Assembly" in less than a month after the promise was made.
					
					 They lashed out at the Lee regime for pressing for the issue of concluding the treaty without holding even an open hearing.
					
					 They branded such military cooperation with Japan as an intolerable action as Japan is keen on grabbing Tok islets and denying its past crimes.
					
					 This diametrically runs counter to peace and stability in Northeast Asia including the Korean Peninsula as it is to secure a legal means needed to establish the missile defense system led by the U.S., the bodies noted.
					
					 The military cooperation intensified between south Korea and Japan is prompted by the U.S. strategy on world domination and this is just a joint product of Japan's militarist ambition and the Lee regime's policy for confrontation with compatriots, they said.
					
					 The conclusion of the treaty with Japan is just an act of opening a road for aggression, said the organizations, adding that such an action should be checked without fail.
					
					 They called on all south Koreans to shatter to pieces in unity the move to conclude the treaty.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Speech to Children Introduced by Mexican Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Speech to Children Introduced by Mexican Organization
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea carried the full text of the congratulatory speech made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) organizations in celebration of its 66th birthday in its bulletin No. 91.
					 He, in his speech on June 6, 2012, expressed his steadfast will to invariably carry forward the noble outlook of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on future and the rising generation.
					
					 He also indicated tasks and ways for bringing up the KCU members to be reserves, knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy, who will be responsible for the future destiny of the country and the nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Internet Websites of Russian, Ukrainian Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Internet Websites of Russian, Ukrainian Organizations
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Rostov-Na-Donu Anti-Bourgeois Front posted on its Internet homepage on June 22 the full text of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People".
					 The work, published on April 20, 2012, deals with the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It indicates the tasks for firmly defending their ideas and exploits and glorifying them for all ages.
					
					 The full text of Kim Jong Un's work "Let's Dynamically Struggle for a Final Victory, Holding Aloft the Banner of Songun" was posted on an Internet website of Ukraine on June 17.
					
					 The speech, made public on April 15, 2012, says that the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation is a history which proved an immutable truth that an outstanding leader assures the dignity and prosperity of the country and the nation.
					
					 The work also indicates tasks for exalting the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully building a thriving socialist country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Loving Care for Children Lauded by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Loving Care for Children Lauded by British Organization
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its Internet website on June 13 an article and photo introducing an event of celebrating the 66th birthday of the Korean Children's Union (KCU).
					 The homepage carried a photo of the dear respected Kim Jong Un present at the joint national meeting of the KCU organizations in celebration of its 66th birthday.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 Shortly ago, the world witnessed the KCU members full of discipline and vitality through the event in Pyongyang, the capital city of Juche Korea.
					
					 They were particularly moved by the fatherly loving care shown by Kim Jong Un for the children true to the idea and the will of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Un appeared on the platform at the joint national meeting of the KCU organizations in celebration of its 66th birthday together with children, not with senior party and state officials.
					
					 It proved that the DPRK regards the children as the successors to the revolution and the reliable builders of socialism and future.
					
					 It is something unthinkable in the capitalist countries that the state takes a step to mobilize airplanes for the delegates to the event.
					
					 The Korean children's future is bright in the socialist system centered on the masses in which the President's idea of believing in the people as in Heaven is applied.
					
					 The children of the DPRK will also vigorously advance to the final victory under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Achievements in DPRK Introduced in Finland
articles.content:
Achievements in DPRK Introduced in Finland
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Finnish paper Kansan Eeni on June 25 carried an impression of the DPRK visit by the delegation of the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					 In the period of the visit the members of the delegation saw for themselves the features of the Korean people emerging victorious in socialist construction, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 Pyongyang, capital of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, was very clean.
					
					 Many dwelling houses were built in Pyongyang in recent years.
					
					 The Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm which was recently built shows well the rapid development of the DPRK.
					
					 The country has made great efforts for the IT development.
					
					 A ceremony of unveiling the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill took place with splendor in Pyongyang on April 13.
					
					 It was a significant event which showed the noble obligation and loyalty of the dear respected Kim Jong Un to the leaders of the preceding generations.
					
					 The military parade which took place on April 15 left the deepest impression.
					
					 The visit of the delegation served as a really important occasion for having better understanding of the DPRK.
					
					 During the visit the delegation could feel again the fixed will of the Korean people to build a powerful socialist nation.

articles.title: Guinean Political Figures Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Guinean Political Figures Visit DPRK Embassy
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Guinean political figures visited the DPRK embassy in the country on June 16 and 18 to mark the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea. They included the general secretary of the Democratic Party of Guinea and members of the National Political Bureau of the party and Lansana Komara, permanent secretary of the Guinean People's Assembly, and members of the National Political Bureau of the party.
					 They laid floral baskets before the full-length portrait of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and made a bow.

articles.title: July 4 Joint Statement Is Most Realistic, Fair Proposal for Korea's Reunification: French Personage
articles.content:
July 4 Joint Statement Is Most Realistic, Fair Proposal for Korea's Reunification: French Personage
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- A meeting for solidarity with the Korean people took place in France on June 23 on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the July 4 joint statement.
					 Present there were officials of the France-Korea Friendship Association and its Northern Regional Committee and other people.  Present there on invitation were officials of the DPRK mission.
					
					 The chairman of the Northern Regional Committee of the association said in his speech:
					
					 The July 4 joint statement is the most realistic and fair proposal for Korea's reunification as it reflects the unanimous wish and desire of the Korean people.
					
					 The joint statement evoked lively response not only from the Korean people but the world people.
					
					 The June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration which were provided by leader Kim Jong Il are a landmark for achieving the country's reunification by the Korean nation itself.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people, is wisely leading the Korean people in their struggle to successfully carry out the plan of Kim Jong Il for national reunification.
					
					 The DPRK is adhering to the peace-loving stand and making sincere efforts for reunification but the situation on the Korean Peninsula is aggravating to the extremes due to the adventurous war moves of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities.
					
					 We are strongly denouncing the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for their moves for igniting a war and will further intensify the solidarity movement for supporting the Korean people's struggle for peace, stability and reunification on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Replace Korean Armistice Agreement with Peace Treaty: British Organizations
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Replace Korean Armistice Agreement with Peace Treaty: British Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- British organizations issued statements on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in a joint statement on June 23 cited facts to expose that the U.S. imperialists, the chieftain of imperialism and international reactionaries, ignited the Korean war in June 1950. But the Korean people defeated the aggressors and honorably defended the independence and sovereignty of the country under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, a gifted strategist and invincible and iron-willed commander, the statement noted.
					
					 The victory in the Fatherland Liberation War was a shining fruition of his Songun idea, it added.
					
					 The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in a statement on June 22 said that though much water has flown under the bridge since the Armistice Agreement was signed in Korea, the U.S. imperialists are still imposing unspeakable misfortune and sufferings on the Korean people and obstructing the reunification of Korea, adding that the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea presents itself as a very urgent issue in achieving the cause of Korea's reunification.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists should replace the Korean Armistice Agreement with a peace agreement and stop at once their hostile moves and provocative rackets for a war against the DPRK, it stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Group of Traitors Censured by Nepali Personages
articles.content:
S. Korean Group of Traitors Censured by Nepali Personages
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Chairman of the International Committee for the Study of Songun Politics for Peaceful Reunification of Korea in Nepal Basanta Kumar Shrestha and its Vice-Chairman Pramod Raj Sedhain issued a joint statement on June 25 denouncing the south Korean regime for hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					 Laying bare the acts of south Korean conservative media which hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, the statement said:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group  made up of henchmen of the U.S. and south Korean conservative media should feel due responsibility for the negative impacts it had on the world media by misleading the public opinion against the DPRK and stop such acts at once.
					
					 If they continue resorting to bad acts to defame the personality of the distinguished leaders of the DPRK as great men, they will be more sternly condemned by the DPRK and progressive mankind.
					
					 The group of traitors should apologize, though belatedly, before the resentment of the Korean people is given a vent.

articles.title: Month of Solidarity with Korean People Begins in Cuba
articles.content:
Month of Solidarity with Korean People Begins in Cuba
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- An opening ceremony of the month of solidarity with the Korean people took place in Cuba on June 25.
					 Present there were officials of the Cuban Foreign Ministry, the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples and the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification and other people. Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador and other embassy officials in Havana.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 Juan Jose Leon Vega, first vice-chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, said: 
					
					 On June 25, 1950 the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet regime ignited a war against the DPRK. The army and people of the DPRK honorably defended the country by giving full play to heroic self-sacrificing spirit and bravery under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung. The U.S. imperialists and their followers suffered disgraceful defeat in the Korean war and signed the Armistice Agreement on July 27, 1953. The myth of their "mightiness" was shattered to smithereens.
					
					 Cuba and the DPRK are struggling hand in hand in the anti-imperialist front. The U.S. imperialists can never break the will of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Sri Lankan President Calls for Boosting Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Sri Lankan President Calls for Boosting Relations with DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa was presented with credentials by DPRK Ambassador to his country Rim Hoe Song on June 26.
					 He was pleased with the favorably developing relations between Sri Lanka and the DPRK, he said, stressing the need to continue boosting these relations in the future, too.

articles.title: Cuba Denounces U.S. Worsening Media Campaign
articles.content:
Cuba Denounces U.S. Worsening Media Campaign 
						
 Havana, June 30 (KCNA) -- The U.S. government seems to strengthen its media defamatory campaign against Cuba, Granma newspaper reported on June 27.
					 The discredit campaign is one of the features of the White House-promoted policy against the Caribbean country, the newspaper said.
					
					 The U.S. has spent over $200 million USD since 1997 for subversion and internal destabilization, excluding the resources destined for identical purpose by intelligence agencies, it noted.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The governments of Indonesia and Iraq on Wednesday agreed to cooperate on energy sector.
					 Venezuela and Belarus signed on Tuesday more than 20 accords to boost bilateral cooperation in the areas of oil, gas, industry, housing and agriculture.

articles.title: U.S. Conducts Interceptor Missile Test
articles.content:
U.S. Conducts Interceptor Missile Test
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. conducted another interceptor missile test on June 26 despite strong protest and denunciation of the international community.
					 It launched an interceptor missile targeting a medium-range ballistic missile in Hawaii that day.

articles.title: Two NATO Soldiers Killed in Eastern Afghan Blast
articles.content:
Two NATO Soldiers Killed in Eastern Afghan Blast
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Two NATO soldiers were killed in a blast in eastern Afghanistan on Wednesday.
					 The latest casualties have brought the number of foreign soldiers killed in Afghanistan to 218 so far this year.

articles.title: Noda Cabinet's Support Rate Slips to 29.9 Percent
articles.content:
Noda Cabinet's Support Rate Slips to 29.9 Percent
						
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Public support for Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda's Cabinet has declined to 29.9 percent, down 2.1 percentage points from early June, an opinion poll by Kyodo News showed Wednesday.
					 The disapproval rate stood at 54.3 percent, up from the previous poll's 50.0 percent.
